@EricTopol @AmerAcadPeds Why are primmary infections more than three times in universal masking districts? And, doesn't such a high rate explain the lower secondary infections rate?

It seems like bad data.

@DeltaNado @EricTopol @AmerAcadPeds You can make them randomized but not necessarily blind or double-blind 😉 This is why I believe being Bayesian here (i.e. combining multiple sources of data with different qualities of evidence) beats being deontological about how science should be done.

But I hear you, sure!
@EricTopol @AmerAcadPeds I mean how is this any different to antivaxxers claiming ADE because case rates without systematic testing are higher among the vaccinated?

@EricTopol @AmerAcadPeds It takes a bold analyst to claim a 2x-7x reduction when the total infection rate was 2x-3x higher in schools with universal masking and there was no systematic method for discriminating primary from secondary infections! https://t.co/YHrowCBECV
@jacobwolff @EricTopol @AmerAcadPeds It’s not beneficial nor harmless. Children have been permanently affected by this. Development, speech, socialization
@EricTopol @AmerAcadPeds Could you put this in English so I can show to my in-laws?

@EricTopol @AmerAcadPeds What is this joke of a study? I know personally what it is to be in an optional school. The ventilation is upgraded, cohorts are created, my son wore a N95 and big distances are kept so optional means nothing!
@MiWieczor @enough021418 @EricTopol @AmerAcadPeds Or because they’re doing more testing to start with whereas districts without mitigation efforts generally weren’t

@EricTopol @AmerAcadPeds How do you know this report / math is even valid? You haven’t even considered the risk. Damage to children’s speech  and reading skill caused by facial covering. These numbers are meaningless in the bigger context. Stop naval gazing just to be right.
